Title: Heart of a Dog
Actors: Evgeniy Evstigneev, Vladimir Tolokonnikov, Boris Plotnikov
Plot: Old Prof. Preobrazhensky and his young colleague Dr. Bormental inserted the human's hypophysis into a dog's brain. Couple of weeks later the dog became "human looking". The main question is "Is anybody who is looking like a man, A REAL MAN?"

Title: The Meeting Place Cannot Be Changed
Well, Just You Wait!
Writer: Feliks Kamov, Arkadiy Khayt, Aleksandr Kurlyandskiy
Plot: Inside this short animated film is three tiny plots about a wolf, obsessed with the dream of eating a little hare. Story One: A wolf in a shooting gallery is trying to hit a target depicting a hare - but everything is passing by. The second story: The little hare is still a very tiny child, he is carried in a stroller. Mom-Hare leaves the stroller at the store, trusts her son her umbrella, and she goes shopping. The wolf kidnaps the stroller and rolls it down the street. The third story: The bunny is already older, but still a preschooler. He carries home-bought bagels from the store, trying in vain to gnaw one of them. The wolf beckons the hungry Bunny with the help of a carrot on a string - and triumphs, intending to eat him soon.
